definition: to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: Tanya: I assume we don't need to worry about creating a need, with summer almost here.
sentences.chinese: 我想夏季就要惠临，我们不用再为缔造需求而担忧。

sentences.english: Good afternoon, sir. Welcome to FOSHBN Electrcical Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 中午好，先生，欢迎惠临佛山电子旅社。

sentences.english: goodbye and thank you for coming.
She worked hard in order that everything would be ready by 6 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 她拼命干活以便惠临点时把一切都筹备停当。

sentences.english: Opportunity, sooner or later, comes to all who work.
sentences.chinese: 只须努力事业而有志向，机缘迟早终会惠临。

sentences.english: Thank you for your Presence tonight.
The golden age ended with the advent of World War 1.
sentences.chinese: 这段黄金岁月因为第一次世界年夜战的惠临而竣事。

definition: (of distinguished guest) honor my house (firm etc) with your presence
to find time to do sth in the midst of pressing affairs
to lie prostrate/to prostrate oneself (in veneration)
variant of 嘉賓|嘉宾[jia1 bin1]
peace all year round (old letter closing)
(humble expr.) prepare to offer humble hospitality/please accept my inadequate (food or drink)
to attend (an official function)/to be present/to administer/to approach (esp. as administrator)
variant of 蒞|莅[li4], to attend
(honorific) revered news/the most valuable information (in your recent letter, book etc)/Thank you for your letter.
